pr_title: Document change, change model download url to PyTorch model zoo

timeline.message:
Merge pull request #1 from gunandrose4u/jozh/doc_ref_change

Modify url ref to blob

Merge pull request #2 from gunandrose4u/revert-1-jozh/doc_ref_change

Revert "Modify url ref to blob"

timeline.bodyText: This endpoint needs to be the real one from local store that was created in previous article.
timeline.author: maxluk

timeline.bodyText: I believe this can be google cloud storage or any other cloud storage as well. Probably having a generic name as 'cloud_OR_noncloud-endpoint' and then providing explicit s3 or azure or gc example should help.
timeline.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,7 +30,7 @@ Similar to the [Inference API](inference_api.md), the Management API provides a
 * response_timeout - If the model's backend worker doesn't respond with inference response within this timeout period, the worker will be deemed unresponsive and rebooted. The units is seconds. The default value is 120 seconds.
 
 ```bash
-curl -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?url=https://<s3_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"
+curl -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?url=https://<s3_or_azureblob_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"

timeline.message: change the endpoints name to a more general one

timeline.bodyText: @gunandrose4u This will be more like <cloud_OR_noncloud_storage> and not endpoint, please change
timeline.author: chauhang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,7 +30,7 @@ Similar to the [Inference API](inference_api.md), the Management API provides a
 * response_timeout - If the model's backend worker doesn't respond with inference response within this timeout period, the worker will be deemed unresponsive and rebooted. The units is seconds. The default value is 120 seconds.
 
 ```bash
-curl -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?url=https://<s3_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"
+curl -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?url=https://<cloud_OR_noncloud-endpoint>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"

timeline.bodyText: @gunandrose4u This will be more like <cloud_OR_noncloud_storage> and not endpoint, please change
timeline.author: chauhang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -43,7 +43,7 @@ you can choose between synchronous or asynchronous call to make sure initial wor
 The asynchronous call returns with HTTP code 202 before trying to create workers.
 
 ```bash
-curl -v -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?initial_workers=1&synchronous=false&url=https://<s3_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"
+curl -v -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?initial_workers=1&synchronous=false&url=https://<cloud_OR_noncloud-endpoint>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"

timeline.bodyText: @gunandrose4u This will be more like <cloud_OR_noncloud_storage> and not endpoint, please change
timeline.author: chauhang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -59,7 +59,7 @@ curl -v -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?initial_workers=1&synchronous=fals
 The synchronous call returns with HTTP code 200 after all workers have been adjusted.
 
 ```bash
-curl -v -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?initial_workers=1&synchronous=true&url=https://<s3_path>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"
+curl -v -X POST "http://localhost:8081/models?initial_workers=1&synchronous=true&url=https://<cloud_OR_noncloud-endpoint>/squeezenet_v1.1.mar"

timeline.bodyText: @gunandrose4u This needs to be a working url for the documentation example. We can consider adding .mar file to github
timeline.author: chauhang

replies.bodyText: The link @gunandrose4u has removed is incorrect hence suggestions is to add links from this https://github.com/pytorch/serve/blob/master/docs/model_zoo.md
replies.author: dhaniram-kshirsagar
